page.title: 04Fish farming in Tollerton
page.content: {Fish farming, the lake, St. Hugh's {College, Tollerton. In June 1984 Geoff Dakin and Keith Brewes acquired the use of the lake in the college grounds. Since 1700 the four and a half acre lake has reduced to 9640 square metres. In preparation for farming, they removed 30,000 tons of silt. By the early months of 1985 there were 3000 fish (American Brook Trout-a rare fast maturing fish-one year from fry to table). Planned expansion includes units for cutting, freezing and smoking the fish. The fresh fish is to be supplied directly to restaurants and frozen to Nottingham market. The imminent sale of the Hall following the close down of St. Hugh's College puts this enterprise at risk.
